bibl.note: This document is a letter dated September 17, 1798 from governor John Sevier of Tennessee to the president of the United States, John Adams. The purpose of the letter is to inform Adams of sundry resolutions passed by companies of cavalry and infantry tendering their services if they are needed.

div.p: It affords me great pleasure to have it in my power to transmit to you, sundry resolutions entered into by your Companies of Cavalry and mounted Infantry belonging to the District of Washington together with and address from Captains Gillispin & Nelson__

You will discover sir, that they have tendered their Services to the President provided the former should become necessary, and be assured that the officers and privates, will do honor both to their country and Selves should they have an opportunity of rendering the Same__ You may also expect with certainty that four more companies from this State of the same kind will be ready to turn out on the Shortest Notice__

closer.add: I have the honor to be Sir, with every sentiment of respect Your Mo. ob. Servt. Most Obedient Servant
John Adams Esquire president of the United States
